Empat Bahaya Keberadaan Dewan Pengawas KPK
05 Nov 2019, 00:45 by Caesar Akbar, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Keberadaan Dewan Pengawas KPK menuai polemik di masyarakat. Pasalnya, keberadaan Dewan Pengawas dianggap bakal melemahkan Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi.
Nama-nama yang bakal mengisi posisi Dewan Pengawas KPK pada periode awal akan ditunjuk langsung oleh Presiden Joko Widodo. Hal ini sesuai dengan Pasal 69 A ayat (1) UU Nomor 19 tahun 2019 tentang KPK.
"Untuk pertama kalinya tidak lewat pansel," kata Jokowi dalam dialog bersama wartawan Istana Kepresidenan di Istana Merdeka, Jakarta, Jumat pekan lalu. Ia berjanji para anggota dewan pengawas yang bakal dilantik Desember mendatang akan memiliki kredibilitas baik.
Dari berbagai sumber, Tempo mencatat setidaknya ada 4 poin catatan dari masyarakat soal bahaya dewan pengawas tersebut.

1. Kriteria dan kode etiknya dinilai lemah

Tim transisi KPK menilai Dewan Pengawas akan melemahkan lembaga. Sebab, dengan posisi yang dinilai lebih berkuasa ketimbang pimpinan KPK, syarat menjadi anggota dewan pengawas dinilai lebih mudah.
Misalnya saja, pimpinan KPK diharuskan berijazah sarjana hukum atau sarjana lain yang memiliki keahlian dan pengalaman paling sedikit 15 tahun dalam bidang hukum, ekonomi, keuangan atau perbankan. Syarat itu tak ada untuk dewan pengawas.
Ketua Umum Yayasan Lembaga Bantuan Hukum Indonesia Asfinawanati menganggap siapapun yang akan dipilih menjadi Dewan Pengawas akibatnya akan sama buruk bagi KPK.
Sebab, menurut UU KPK yang baru, posisi Dewan Pengawas lebih berkuasa dari komisioner, sedangkan aturan kode etiknya lebih lemah dan mekanisme pemilihannya dilakukan dengan lebih sederhana. "Ini sistem. Jadi siapapun yang dipilih (sebagai Dewan Pengawas), dia sudah di bawah cengkeraman Presiden,” kata Asfina.

2. Informasi rawan bocor

Sejumlah pihak menilai keberadaan Dewan Pengawas membuat rencana operasi tangkap tangan KPK rawan bocor. Belum juga resmi dilantik, Wakil Ketua KPK terpilih Nurul Ghufron telah menyampaikan kekhawatirannya itu.
Dia mengatakan keberadaan Dewas akan menyulitkan KPK melakukan operasi tangkap tangan (OTT). “Kemungkinan agak kesulitan melakukan OTT karena penyadapan harus minta izin, sehingga potensi kebocoran sebelum OTT bisa terjadi.”
Berdasarkan UU KPK hasil revisi, Dewan Pengawas KPK berwenang memberikan izin tertulis untuk penyadapan, penggeledahan, hingga penyitaan meskipun tidak berstatus sebagai penegak hukum.

3. Integritas Dewan Pengawas disorot

Tim transisi KPK menyoroti integritas Dewan Pengawas. Sebabnya, tak seperti pimpinan KPK, anggota Dewan Pengawas tidak dilarang bertemu dengan pihak-pihak yang tengah berperkara di KPK.
Dewan Pengawas juga tidak dilarang rangkap jabatan, bahkan untuk menjadi komisaris, direksi, atau pengurus yayasan tertentu. Hal ini menurut tim berpotensi menimbulkan konflik kepentingan.

4. Rentan intervensi politik

Sekretaris Jenderal Transparency International Indonesia Dadang Trisasongko menilai kode etik Dewan Pengawas dibuat lemah karena memang dewan ini dibentuk untuk membuka pintu intervensi politik ke KPK. Ia khawatir KPK tak lagi independen karena keberadaan dewan ini. “Ini penjinakkan KPK.”
Dalam lain kesempatan, Direktur Pusat Kajian Konstitusi Feri Amsari mengatakan pemilihan Anggota Dewan Pengawas yang memiliki integritas sebenarnya bisa meminimalisasi dampak kerusakan yang ditimbulkan oleh keberadaan Dewan Pengawas.
Namun, ia pesimistis Jokowi bakal melakukan itu. Sebab, menurut dia, Jokowi adalah salah satu pihak yang memotori pelemahan KPK melalui revisi UU. Ia menduga Jokowi akan menempatkan orang-orang yang dapat mengakomodasi agendanya untuk menjadi dewan pengawas. “Saya tidak akan terlalu percaya pada pernyataan dari Istana.”

CAESAR AKBAR | ROSSENO AJI

Four Dangers of KPK's Supervisory Board Existence
05 Nov 2019, 00:45 by Caesar Akbar, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The existence of the KPK Supervisory Board is reaping a polemic in the community. Because the existence of the Supervisory Board is considered to weaken the Corruption Eradication Commission.
The names that will fill the KPK Supervisory Board position in the initial period will be appointed directly by President Joko Widodo. This is in accordance with Article 69 A paragraph (1) of Law Number 19 of 2019 concerning the KPK.
"For the first time, it has not been through the selection committee," Jokowi said in a dialogue with reporters at the Presidential Palace at the Merdeka Palace, Jakarta, last Friday. He promised the members of the supervisory board who would be installed next December would have good credibility.
From various sources, Tempo recorded at least 4 points from the public about the danger of the supervisory board.

1. The criteria and code of ethics are considered weak

The KPK transition team assesses the Supervisory Board will weaken the institution. Because, with a position considered more powerful than the leadership of the KPK, the requirement to become a member of the supervisory board is considered easier.
For example, KPK leaders are required to have a legal degree or other degree with expertise and experience of at least 15 years in the fields of law, economics, finance or banking. There are no conditions for the supervisory board.
Chairperson of the Indonesian Legal Aid Foundation Asfinawanati considers that anyone who will be elected to the Supervisory Board will consequently be equally bad for the KPK.
Because, according to the new KPK Law, the position of the Supervisory Board is more powerful than commissioners, while the code of ethics is weaker and the selection mechanism is simpler. "This is a system. So whoever is chosen (as the Supervisory Board), he is already under the clutches of the President," said Asfina.

2. Information is prone to leak

A number of parties consider the existence of the Supervisory Board to make plans for the KPK's arrest arrest mechanism prone to leaking. Not yet officially inaugurated, KPK Deputy Chairperson Nurul Ghufron has expressed his concern.
He said the presence of Dewas would make it difficult for the KPK to conduct hand-catching operations (OTT). "It might be rather difficult to do OTT because wiretapping has to ask permission, so that potential leaks before OTT can occur."
Based on the revised KPK Law, the KPK Supervisory Board has the authority to give written permission for wiretapping, search and seizure, even though it is not a law enforcer.

3. The integrity of the Supervisory Board is highlighted

The KPK transition team highlights the integrity of the Supervisory Board. The reason is that, unlike the leadership of the KPK, members of the Supervisory Board are not prohibited from meeting with parties who are currently at the KPK.
The Supervisory Board is also not prohibited from holding concurrent positions, even to become commissioners, directors, or administrators of certain foundations. This according to the team has the potential to cause conflicts of interest.

4. Vulnerable to political intervention

Secretary General of Transparency International Indonesia Dadang Trisasongko assessed that the Supervisory Board's code of ethics was made weak because this council was formed to open the door for political intervention to the KPK. He was worried that the KPK would no longer be independent because of the existence of this council. "This is taming the KPK."
On another occasion, Director of the Constitutional Review Center Feri Amsari said the selection of Members of the Supervisory Board who had integrity could actually minimize the impact of damage caused by the existence of the Supervisory Board.
However, he was pessimistic Jokowi would do that. Because, according to him, Jokowi was one of the parties who was driving the weakening of the KPK through the revision of the Act. He suspects Jokowi will put people who can accommodate his agenda to become a supervisory board. "I will not believe too much in the statement from the Palace."

CAESAR AKBAR | ROSSENO AJI
